title: Wheat replacement: South Korea partners with local food brands to intensify rice flour NPD - FoodNavigator-Asia.com
summary: South Korea is promoting the use of rice flour as a substitute for wheat flour, driven by the Russia-Ukraine war's impact on wheat supplies and the overproduction of rice in the country. The government is collaborating with 15 food companies to develop 19 new rice-based products, including noodles, bread, snacks, and other products, aiming to increase domestic rice consumption and create a new market for rice flour.
official_company_name: Nongshim Co., Ltd., Samyang Foods Co., Ltd., Mideum Foods Co., Ltd., Pulmuone Co., Ltd.
product_or_process: Rice-based noodles, bread crumbs, jjajang ramen, ramen snacks, rice-based bread, high-protein snacks
likely_naics_codes: ['311111', 'Food Manufacturing', '311811', 'Snack Food Manufacturing', '311911', 'Frozen Food Manufacturing', '311920', 'Dry, Canned, and Preserved Fruits and Vegetables Manufacturing']
greenwashing: The initiative does not appear to be greenwashing as it aims to utilize a domestically overproduced resource and reduce reliance on wheat, promoting a more sustainable food system.
